alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 18 at 1:01PM HST until February 18 at 4:15PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Kauai in Kauai County * Until 415 PM HST. * At 101 PM HST, radar showed that moderate to heavy rainfall was still moving over the east half of Kauai from the southeast. The Hanalei River water level was still elevated and was still expected to inundate Kuhio Highway near the Hanalei Bridge. South Fork Wailua River was also running at a high level. Additional rainfall through the afternoon should keep streams and rivers in east Kauai at high flow levels. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lihue, Kapaa, Kalaheo, Princeville, Kilauea, North Fork Wailua Trails, Wailua Homesteads, Hanalei, Wailua, Lawai, Wainiha, Koloa, Haena, Kokee State Park, Anahola, Poipu, Hanapepe, and Na Pali State Park. This warning may need to be extended beyond 415 PM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown. Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry.
